summary: This document is an email chain from December 10, 2018, between law enforcement officials, including an NYPD/FBI task force detective and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The subject is 'Re: Epstein' and the emails discuss coordinating a call, sharing reports and records, and preparing for an upcoming event on Wednesday.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of an email requesting a brief call to touch base about items in preparation for Wednesday.

events.title: Email coordination about Epstein case
events.description: Law enforcement officials exchange emails to coordinate a call and share information regarding the Epstein investigation, referencing attached reports and records.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Upcoming preparation event
events.description: Mentioned as 'Wednesday' in the email, indicating an upcoming event or deadline requiring preparation by the legal and law enforcement team.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The email chain is dated December 10, 2018, and involves coordination among law enforcement regarding the Epstein case.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is actively involved in preparing for an event on the upcoming Wednesday.
The correspondence references attached reports and records related to Epstein, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
The participants include members of an NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, highlighting a multi-agency effort.
The tone suggests urgency and coordination, with requests for calls and sharing of information.
